title: Israel’s Supreme Court overturns key judicial reform law
summary: Israel’s Supreme Court struck down a major judicial reform law passed by the government, ruling that it undermined democratic principles and judicial independence.

title: Russia launches large-scale drone attack on Ukraine
summary: Ukrainian authorities reported that Russia launched dozens of drones across multiple regions, causing civilian casualties and infrastructure damage.

title: South Korean opposition leader stabbed during public visit
summary: Lee Jae-myung, leader of South Korea’s main opposition party, was stabbed in the neck during a visit to Busan and underwent emergency surgery.

title: Senior Hamas official killed in Israeli strike in Lebanon
summary: Saleh al-Arouri, a senior Hamas political leader, was killed in an Israeli drone strike in Beirut, raising tensions across the region.

title: Russia and Ukraine conduct major prisoner exchange
summary: Russia and Ukraine carried out one of their largest prisoner swaps in months, exchanging more than 200 detainees.

title: Putin signs decree granting citizenship to foreign fighters
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree allowing foreign nationals who fight for Russia to obtain citizenship along with their families.

title: Severe winter storm hits parts of the United States
summary: A powerful winter storm system brought heavy snow, ice, and tornadoes across several U.S. states, resulting in deaths and widespread power outages.

title: U.S. and allies strike Houthi targets in Yemen
summary: The United States and its allies launched airstrikes against Houthi targets in Yemen following repeated attacks on commercial shipping in the Red Sea.

title: Protests erupt in Russia’s Bashkortostan region
summary: Mass protests broke out in Bashkortostan after the sentencing of a local activist, leading to arrests and internet disruptions.

title: Protests continue in Bashkortostan amid security crackdown
summary: Demonstrations continued in several cities in Bashkortostan as authorities increased security measures and detained protesters.
